column1: Joining @tperkins live now to discuss why we need Amy Coney Barrett on the Supreme Court and why COVID relief needs to be targeted to those who need it without political pet projects.  Listen live:  https://t.co/gxXoPsiJHG

The media and Democrats in Congress have been trying to rewrite the history of President Trump's response to the coronavirus pandemic.  Let's look at some of the predictions and the actions President @realDonaldTrump took to prevent them from coming true.  (1/7)

In March the COVID Task Force predicted 100000 to 240000 Americans would lose their lives even with strong mitigation. Dr. Birx in March: “If we do things together well almost perfectly we could get into the range of 100000 to 200000 fatalities.” https://t.co/TlQBjgE6QS

Due in large part to actions taken by President @realDonaldTrump the U.S. has weathered this pandemic better than many other countries.   The U.S. ranks 8th in COVID-19 deaths per capita — lower than the UK Belgium Peru Spain Italy Sweden & Chile. https://t.co/TlQBjgE6QS

For the past 6 months Americans have been subjected to an unprecedented effort by the media and Democrats in Congress to rewrite the history of the COVID pandemic. It has real consequences for our ability to fight the virus and reopen smartly and safely. https://t.co/TlQBjgE6QS

Any new coronavirus stimulus should be targeted at small businesses and those who are still out of work due to COVID lockdowns - not a federal bailout for blue states that have lived beyond their means. https://t.co/eOyKjvDaWR

Indiana’s early voting and absentee ballot voting systems are capable as Hoosiers approach the November general election during the coronavirus pandemic U.S. Sen Mike Braun said Wednesday. https://t.co/iJ31uO3vf4

When I’m in a recess week I travel the state. I visit tons of schools in this case high schools and colleges because to me education is that important. We’re all going through the challenge of how we navigate through this unique challenge of COVID. https://t.co/UDzY1UX1aD

Grace College in Kosciusko County chose to distribute 100% of their coronavirus assistance funds from the CARES Act directly to students. I stopped in today to hear about their plan to reopen to students safely this semester. https://t.co/8Eez7EQ3mc

I stopped in Milan to meet with the team at The Reservation to discuss how coronavirus impacted their business how Paycheck Protection Program funds helped them stay afloat and how Hoosier independent restaurants are coming back safely. https://t.co/DlKdf8rfT8

I’d like to thank Decatur County Memorial Hospital for hosting my roundtable with local community leaders to discuss getting small rural business back up and running and my SAVE Act to ensure Americans are confident that a COVID-19 vaccine is safe and effective. https://t.co/cxwDaDlwQ4

Great perspective from @DrRobertGlatter on the need for the SAVE Act to increase transparency of the vaccine approval process to help Americans feel confident the COVID-19 vaccine is safe for their families. @SenatorHassan @lisamurkowski  https://t.co/shbADszyfZ

Sen. Mike Braun (R-IN) told @BreitbartNews in an exclusive interview on Tuesday that Democrats’ playing politics with the coronavirus negotiations will continue to “sour on the American public.” https://t.co/8m9Ai2yVyn

President @realDonaldTrump is leading an unprecedented all-hands-on-deck mobilization to deliver a safe and effective #COVID19 vaccine.   #OperationWarpSpeed harnesses the full power of American science and we're already seeing promising progress on a vaccine in clinical trials.

President @realDonaldTrump's @WhiteHouse are taking action to protect our most vulnerable in nursing homes from #COVID19:   1. $5 billion in new funding – in addition to approximately $5 billion already approved for skilled nursing facilities.  (1/3)
Joining @cvpayne to talk coronavirus stimulus negotiations after the break. https://t.co/fnEkzNWpWE
“I’m interested in those businesses that got left out” he said.   “As long as we focus on errors and omissions and COVID-related stuff we might get something done” he said. https://t.co/dtVMdlqkZI
I sat down with MyWabashValley outside Terre Haute to answer their questions on the coronavirus the economy police and getting students back to school this fall.  https://t.co/RGJpvsutz7

Healthcare consumers scored two major victories recently in their effort to lower out-of-control healthcare prices which have been brought back front-and-center by the Covid-19 pandemic. @ChuckGrassley  https://t.co/6iTYCrDZAa
I talked with Stu @varneyco on @foxbusiness about Indiana's coronavirus reopening stage four and the JUSTICE Act. https://t.co/VnT59RC4YM

“Something like this where they can be rewarded for their good stewardship just comes at a wonderful time” said Braun who noted farmers are facing hardship now due to low prices during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/pVUQG96E4C

You want the vote to be secure and you don't want any voter suppression so the question comes down to: is our system broken? I don't think so. I think it's another one of Speaker Pelosi's attempts to move more of her agenda broadly into the discussion of coronavirus. @varneyco https://t.co/ivXHzQ50HG
I joined @TeamCavuto to talk about Phase 3 of Indiana's #COVID19 reopen from my favorite restaurant the Schnitzelbank in my hometown Jasper. https://t.co/5gj5achJNt

China’s failure to operate on-the-level regarding COVID-19 has caused untold global devastation and they must be held accountable. If China won’t cooperate with the reasonable measures in ⁦@LindseyGrahamSC⁩’s bill then they should face consequences. https://t.co/W1l9OnBcSL
My questions on testing and getting vaccines and treatments for COVID-19 to people as quickly as possible for Dr. Fauci FDA Commissioner Hahn and CDC Director Redfield ⬇️ https://t.co/BCejDk0CDJ
Encouraging news that @pfizer will begin human trials on their potential coronavirus vaccine in the U.S. on Monday. https://t.co/Fagkk92fOo
The U.S. leads the world in #COVID19 testing by a large margin. https://t.co/v9BV67POcL

A vaccine is what we need most to get us back to business. We need federal regulators to do their part to accelerate development & deployment of vaccines instead of slowing it down.  Read my letter to the WH Task Force calling on @CDCgov to accelerate coronavirus vaccine review⬇️ https://t.co/NPc4I8YRVm
You can watch @INFocusIndiana's Coronavirus Town Hall TONIGHT at 7pm. https://t.co/mD5O9esJnQ

As American citizens do their part to slow the spread of #COVID19 through social distancing and other measures it is critical that our nation’s canneries and frozen food suppliers can keep shelves stocked with a full supply of non-perishable foods. https://t.co/1ZM5re7S7Q

Tune in tomorrow Thursday at 7pm for @FOX59's @INFocusIndiana: A Coronavirus Town Hall hosted by @DanSpehler.  I'll be answering viewer questions live - airing in South Bend Terre Haute Fort Wayne Evansville and Indy.  Submit your questions: https://t.co/kJ1hdv1axw https://t.co/NMFBEtv3TG
I'm joining @GovHolcomb for his daily COVID-19 Briefing today at 2:30pm to discuss the recent federal response for small businesses.  https://t.co/S5BTOgzH2G

A bipartisan group of senators is proposing a bill to ban the U.S. from buying animals from the Chinese "wet markets" that have been blamed for outbreaks including the current coronavirus crisis. @SenJoniErnst  https://t.co/c4uKJcChh0

The broadcast updates the evolving local state and national response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Viewers wishing to send in questions ahead of time for this program may do so by email – info@wfwa.org before 5 p.m. Thursday. https://t.co/M9TNFBG6N4

Many rely on faith-based non-profits for support services in their community especially during #COVIDー19.  I joined @SenatorLankford's lead asking @USTreasury and @SBAgov to ensure these organizations' protections aren't limited because they are faith-based. https://t.co/anEoys8dhC
Join me this morning as I answer questions on the federal response to the coronavirus on @14News in Evansville at 8:20 Eastern/7:20 Central.
Topics including the CARES Act small business assistance and the state’s COVID response will be discussed. https://t.co/ocyRFiP4Os

Praying today for the family and friends of firefighter John Schoffstall who served his community on the Terre Haute Fire Department and lost his battle with COVID-19 this morning. https://t.co/5NRvtAQC3n

”The pandemic demonstrates how we need these expedited procedures more than ever as our country and many others race for therapies that can treat the coronavirus and for a vaccine that can eliminate it.” https://t.co/2zPKhanKuJ

Fort Wayne’s Phoenix America is innovating to fight #COVID19. The PhoenixAir prototype is a less expensive alternative to conventional ventilators designed to conserve medical resources in severe cases. Inspiring work from Scott Mentzer & @TrineUniversity. https://t.co/Gqgo67xgCR

Future virus relief spending should be “very narrowly aimed at anybody we missed” in earlier legislation as well as “the entities and individuals that are most impacted” by #COVID19. https://t.co/hbe74a6MYv

Hoosiers are #INThisTogether and Indiana small business has stepped up to the plate big time to help supply the fight against #COVID19.   I'll be highlighting some of their stories such as these distilleries who have been producing hand sanitizer for those on the frontlines ⬇️ https://t.co/EYxxZYxuQ6

IRS and @USTreasury announced that Hoosier seniors receiving Social Security will automatically receive their coronavirus economic impact payments and beneficiaries who aren't typically required to file tax returns will not need to. See more details at: https://t.co/fuRz7JdIqk https://t.co/ifVMi59x7L

My staff and I are here to help Hoosiers.  Visit my Coronavirus Assistance page for resource guides to help small-business owners non-profit organizations veterans students and employees across the state navigate the federal response to #COVIDー19: https://t.co/AFyrFvHmbR

To ensure Hoosier health providers on the frontlines of the fight against COVID-19 have all medical resources possible I commend @GovHolcomb’s necessary action to order non-urgent elective medical procedures including surgical abortions halted during this crisis.

My staff and I are here to help Hoosiers and these guides will help small-business owners non-profit organizations veterans students and employees across the state navigate the federal response to the coronavirus. https://t.co/mFblA0hu7e

My team is working around the clock to help Hoosiers who have been affected by #COVID_19.  Read our resource guide for small businesses and employees affected by #coronavirus here: https://t.co/VpwMYromwX https://t.co/xgpUqGHCSW

As a former small business owner Sen. Mike Braun (R-Ind.) has made the interests of small businesses and families a major priority in negotiations on the coronavirus aid package. @OANN  https://t.co/8SQgBBl6Rd

While it’s shameful that Congress wasted so much time bickering over this desperately-needed relief now we must work together as one country to flatten the coronavirus curve so we do not flatten our economy.
THREAD: The #coronavirus impacts our health and our economy and I will be supporting this assistance package which provides massive assistance for our hospitals...

You are either helping right now or hurting. Pelosi’s handpicked partisan ploys are helping no one. She’s hurting American families by prioritizing airplane emissions same day voter registration&wind energy tax credits over #coronavirus relief. #StopTheGamesNancy #PassTheBill

If we do not get something done on #coronavirus relief and have to wait until Wednesday we will all be held accountable.   We’d be doing what this place normally does - not working for the people who sent us here.   I want to throw the gauntlet down and do it publicly: https://t.co/nhqeOppt8V

We don’t need more time: all of us agree small business owners and waged and hourly workers who have been displaced by our efforts to fight #coronavirus need to be priority one. @MSNBC https://t.co/mwETpC52Z3
I’ll be on with @HallieJackson on @MSNBC shortly to discuss the way forward for the stalled #coronavirus relief package Hoosier small businesses and workers need done today.
I'm joining Steve Bannon and @JasonMillerinDC on @WarRoomPandemic now to discuss the path forward for the #coronavirus relief package for American workers. Listen live here:  https://t.co/GaxGfA41ve

We must do everything we can to fight #COVIDー19; now we're in a race between flattening the curve but not flattening the economy.   We’re in day 8 of @realDonaldTrump's #15DaystoSlowtheSpread and after that we'll take everything we’ve learned & maybe modify where we need to. https://t.co/mEoiZBL80i

All along I’ve said small business and waged workers need to be the priority and that is in here. I hear some are trying to throw things into this #coronavirus package concerning infrastructure Social Security things that have nothing to do with this - I think that’s shameful. https://t.co/C2jP9gOBEL
Calling in to WLDE in Fort Wayne at 9:30 to answer some questions about moving forward with #coronavirus relief for Hoosier workers and small businesses. Listen here: https://t.co/VryKLHmTrY
Joining @Varneyco on @FoxBusiness  shortly to discuss putting political quibbling aside for small businesses and workers who desperately need  the #COVIDー19 relief package. https://t.co/8Ti00cqgDS
I’ll be on @foxandfriends this morning to discuss getting relief to small businesses and workers now and balancing the fight against #Covid_19 with safeguarding our economy. Coming up at 9:15.

We all want to do the same thing: take care of hard-working people and small businesses who are displaced by this pandemic. This is urgent.  In 2 weeks we need to evaluate if our actions are the right approach to tamp down the coronavirus without taking down our economy. https://t.co/4b2EBHhwKP

I commend President @realDonaldTrump @VP Pence Dr. Deborah Birx Dr. Anthony Fauci & all our healthcare professionals for their hard work. It’s important for Hoosiers to wash their hands limit time in public help their neighbors & together we will defeat #COVID2019.

As we move to the next funding phase I will work with the Trump administration to avoid the mistakes of previous corporate bailouts while continuing to fight for individuals and small business owners affected by the #CoronavirusOutbreak.

As a Main Street entrepreneur it’s clear the #coronavirus phase 2 assistance package is far from perfect but we live in a divided government & it has my support because it adds resources to our healthcare system & helps families/small businesses directly affected by #COVID2019.

I think we’re going to find when we sort through all this that the two travel bans President @realDonaldTrump put in place were the biggest investment we made in tamping the #CoronavirusOutbreak down and flattening the curve. @IngrahamAngle https://t.co/uBVkvhpSU6
We need to focus first on help for people really impacted by the #CoronavirusOutbreak - wage earners and small businesses. https://t.co/uBVkvhpSU6

In studio with @IngrahamAngle tonight to discuss what families and small businesses need in the #COVID2019 federal assistance package ideas for bringing drugs to treat and vaccines to prevent #coronavirus to market faster and how we can all slow the spread of the outbreak.

You and your family can take everyday actions to help prevent the spread of #COVID_19 ⬇️  🔹Stay home when sick 🔹Avoid touching your face 🔹Disinfect frequently used objects 🔹Wash hands often  With proper precautions we can stop the spread. @weatherchannel https://t.co/4fNxcooTuP

While it’s important that Congress moves quickly to help families and small business owners address #COVID_19 it also can’t be rushed in such a manner that repeats the mistakes of previous corporate bailouts and failed stimulus packages.  (2/2)

Every individual needs to take their own precautions: Get tested if you are experiencing #COVID_19 symptoms and please stay away from places that are vulnerable.   My thoughts on U.S. infrastructure to deal with the outbreak and economic stimulus proposals from @ABC57News: https://t.co/h4wMkFvSDW

We cannot create a hysteria out of coronavirus when the facts don't warrant it. We have an infrastructure that helps us prepare for this much better than any other country. @foxnewsnight @shannonbream https://t.co/Bh7L5MkKGT

Sen. Braun affirmed that the US is “in as good a shape” and “as prepared” as any nation to manage #coronavirus given the infrastructure the country has while Democrats like Sen. Chuck Schumer are trying to “weaponize” the infection to win political points. https://t.co/Rasgef93Ce
#Coronavirus should make companies that have gone deeply into China with their supply chains look at spreading their eggs into other baskets. @business @DavidWestin https://t.co/3Q4aGYSujQ
I think @VP Pence is in a perfect spot to lead this #coronavirus  effort and I was glad @realDonaldTrump gave him this responsibility. https://t.co/tcMOSAY5WR

Full interview with @HallieJackson on @MSNBC on why we need to put the coronavirus's effect on our economy in perspective why we're the best prepared country in the world to deal with it and why @VP Pence is a great choice to oversee the U.S. response. https://t.co/BShV7cD1X0

We have better infrastructure to deal with coronavirus than anywhere else in the world. It's a new and virulent virus and we can't take it lightly but we're the best-prepared place in the world. @teamcavuto https://t.co/gOv0vdcch4

On coronavirus I listened to the Department of Homeland Security the CDC the FDA the NIH and it looked to me like the US is absolute picture of preparedness right now. It's sad that some are politicizing this and the public sees through it. @Varneyco @foxbusiness https://t.co/p17uKvAwPq
Great visit in South Bend discussing healthcare and why Indiana is well-prepared for the coronavirus.  https://t.co/v5zQMDRCvJ
